title: Value at Risk (VaR)
content:
# Value at Risk (VaR)

VaR asks the question: "What is my worst-case loss, with X% confidence, over the next N days?"

## Historical Method
1.  Calculate historical daily returns.
2.  Sort them from worst to best.
3.  Find the cutoff for the worst 5% (for 95% Confidence).

## Parametric Method
Assumes normal distribution. `VaR = Mean - (Z-score * StdDev)`.
code:
import numpy as np

# Mock daily returns (1000 days)
returns = np.random.normal(0.0005, 0.01, 1000)

# 95% Confidence VaR (Historical)
var_95 = np.percentile(returns, 5)

print(f"95% VaR (Daily): {var_95:.2%}")
print(f"Interpretation: With 95% confidence, we will not lose more than {abs(var_95):.2%} in one day.")
